name: Drawing on influences
description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

key_work.title: Set design in Little J and Big Cuz
key_work.creator_credit: Tony Thorne and Ned Lander Media Pty Ltd
key_work.brief_description: Five-year-old Little J and nine-year-old Big Cuz are a couple of indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and old dog. All their friends are nearby, and school is just a stroll away along a bush track.

constellations_primary.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_primary.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls
constellations_other.description: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls explores the reality of living in Mparntwe (Alice Springs) through the eyes of the artists, who grew up there. Place and Indigenous representation are also vital to the other works in this Constellation.

start.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
start.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
start.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

links.description: Before creating Little J and Big Cuz, Tony Thorne worked as an animator on Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, most notably animating Malfoy’s snake in his face-off against Harry.

start.title: His Dark Materials

video_links.name: His Dark Materials: Season 1 | San Diego Comic Con Trailer | HBO
His Dark Materials: Season 1 | Official Trailer | HBO

start.brief_description: Follows the adventures of Lyra, an orphan who lives in a parallel universe in which science, theology and magic are entwined.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

end.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
end.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
end.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: Child star Harry Melling, who portrayed Dudley Dursley in the Harry Potter series, has gone on to a range of interesting roles, including the Coen Brothers’ The Ballad of Buster Scruggs and the HBO series His Dark Materials.

start.title: Never Alone
start.brief_description:
Never Alone (Kisima Ingitchuna) is an atmospheric puzzle platformer and the first game to be developed in collaboration with the Iñupiat, an Alaska Native people, drawn from a traditional story that has been shared across the generations. Nearly 40 Alaska Native elders, storytellers and community members contributed to the development of the game.

It features two characters, and it can be played in single-player mode or play cooperatively with a friend as you trek through frozen tundra, leap across treacherous ice floes, swim through underwater caverns and face enemies both strange and familiar.

You’ll explore awe-inspiring environments, perform heroic deeds and meet legendary characters from Iñupiaq stories — all narrated by a master storyteller in the spoken Iñupiaq language.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Indigenous futurisms
constellations_other.description: An exploration of works that put First Peoples futurisms first.

end.title: His Dark Materials

video_links.name: His Dark Materials: Season 1 | San Diego Comic Con Trailer | HBO
His Dark Materials: Season 1 | Official Trailer | HBO

end.brief_description: Follows the adventures of Lyra, an orphan who lives in a parallel universe in which science, theology and magic are entwined.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

links.description: Never Alone‘s main character Nuna and her white Arctic fox trek through the Alaskan snow, not unlike Lyrsa and her familiar Pan, who trek through snowy landscapes in His Dark Materials.

start.title: Steven Universe
start.creator_credit: Chuck Austen, Jackie Buscarino and Cartoon Network
start.brief_description: A young boy takes his mother’s place in a group of gemstone-based beings, and must learn to control his powers.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

end.title: The Snow Queen
end.brief_description: When the Snow Queen, a lonely and powerful fairy, kidnaps the human boy Kay, his best friend Gerda must overcome many obstacles on her journey to rescue him.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

links.description: Steven Universe showrunner Rebecca Sugar nearly wore out the tape of their VHS copy of Russian animated film The Snow Queen as a child, which became a major influence on Steven Universe.

start.title: Never Alone
start.brief_description:
Never Alone (Kisima Ingitchuna) is an atmospheric puzzle platformer and the first game to be developed in collaboration with the Iñupiat, an Alaska Native people, drawn from a traditional story that has been shared across the generations. Nearly 40 Alaska Native elders, storytellers and community members contributed to the development of the game.

It features two characters, and it can be played in single-player mode or play cooperatively with a friend as you trek through frozen tundra, leap across treacherous ice floes, swim through underwater caverns and face enemies both strange and familiar.

You’ll explore awe-inspiring environments, perform heroic deeds and meet legendary characters from Iñupiaq stories — all narrated by a master storyteller in the spoken Iñupiaq language.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_other.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

links.description: Little J and Big Cuz ceebrates First Peoples traditions, culture and stories, and has been translated into local languages. Similarly, Never Alone (Kisima Inŋitchuŋa), made by Alaska’s Iñupiaq people, passes down traditional oral stories through a new medium.

start.title: Princess Mononoke
start.creator_credit: Toshio Suzuki, Nippon Television Network Corporation and Neil Gaiman
start.brief_description: Ashitaka, a prince of the disappearing Emishi people, is cursed by a demonized boar god and must journey to the west to find a cure. Along the way, he encounters San, a young human woman fighting to protect the forest, and Lady Eboshi, who is trying to destroy it. Ashitaka must find a way to bring balance to this conflict.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Speculative futures, sci-fi worlds and environmental disaster
constellations_other.description: Deborah Kelly's The Gods of Tiny Things explores extinction and the climate crisis, the scars of colonialism, and the political shift to the right around the world through collage and imagined futures, much like these sci-fi, animated and computer-generated artworks.

end.title: Never Alone
end.brief_description:
Never Alone (Kisima Ingitchuna) is an atmospheric puzzle platformer and the first game to be developed in collaboration with the Iñupiat, an Alaska Native people, drawn from a traditional story that has been shared across the generations. Nearly 40 Alaska Native elders, storytellers and community members contributed to the development of the game.

It features two characters, and it can be played in single-player mode or play cooperatively with a friend as you trek through frozen tundra, leap across treacherous ice floes, swim through underwater caverns and face enemies both strange and familiar.

You’ll explore awe-inspiring environments, perform heroic deeds and meet legendary characters from Iñupiaq stories — all narrated by a master storyteller in the spoken Iñupiaq language.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Indigenous futurisms
constellations_other.description: An exploration of works that put First Peoples futurisms first.

links.description: Just as Never Alone‘s Nuna and her white fox are assisted by local Iñupiat spirits, in a retelling of the traditional story Kunuuksaayuka, Princess Mononoke‘s San and her wolf familiar work alongside forest spirits to help restore balance to the world.

start.title: Set design in Little J and Big Cuz
start.creator_credit: Tony Thorne and Ned Lander Media Pty Ltd
start.brief_description: Five-year-old Little J and nine-year-old Big Cuz are a couple of indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and old dog. All their friends are nearby, and school is just a stroll away along a bush track.

end.title: Steven Universe
end.creator_credit: Chuck Austen, Jackie Buscarino and Cartoon Network
end.brief_description: A young boy takes his mother’s place in a group of gemstone-based beings, and must learn to control his powers.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

links.description: Tony Thorne was inspired by the colour palette of Steven Universe‘s background art when creating Little J and Big Cuz’. Like the latter, the first Australian animated series for First Peoples children, Steven Universe is acclaimed for leading mainstream representation of queer and gender-expansive characters.

start.title: The Snow Queen
start.brief_description: When the Snow Queen, a lonely and powerful fairy, kidnaps the human boy Kay, his best friend Gerda must overcome many obstacles on her journey to rescue him.

constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

end.title: Princess Mononoke
end.creator_credit: Toshio Suzuki, Nippon Television Network Corporation and Neil Gaiman
end.brief_description: Ashitaka, a prince of the disappearing Emishi people, is cursed by a demonized boar god and must journey to the west to find a cure. Along the way, he encounters San, a young human woman fighting to protect the forest, and Lady Eboshi, who is trying to destroy it. Ashitaka must find a way to bring balance to this conflict.

constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: Speculative futures, sci-fi worlds and environmental disaster
constellations_other.description: Deborah Kelly's The Gods of Tiny Things explores extinction and the climate crisis, the scars of colonialism, and the political shift to the right around the world through collage and imagined futures, much like these sci-fi, animated and computer-generated artworks.

links.description: In the early 1960s, Princess Mononoke director Hiyao Miyazaki, was disillusioned with animation, and was about to quit until he saw The Snow Queen, which has since become one of his favourite films.
